posts.post_content:
Combos incredibly with any of the Ravnica bouncelands and any landfall ability, hence EDH bannage.   
Example: Turn one: any Mox/Sol Ring, Forest, Fastbond, Ornithopter/Memnite/Phy Walker/Kobolds/free whatever, Adventuring Gear.  
Turn two: Equip Gear to free creature, then play the bounceland (bouncing itself) 19 times, then swing for the win.   
  
Still not vintage material, but that took me two minutes to figure out. If you put some effort into it, you could do a lot better. And that's Fastbond.

Turn two: Equip Gear to free creature, then play the bounceland (bouncing itself) 19 times, then swing for the win.

Still not vintage material, but that took me two minutes to figure out. If you put some effort into it, you could do a lot better. And that's Fastbond.

Posted By: ClockworkSwordfish (11/18/2010 6:41:44 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I combined this with two [Lifegift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lifegift)s and [Meloku, the Clouded Mirror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Meloku, the Clouded Mirror) to get infinite 1/1 fliers and infinite life. At that point my giant [Ageless Entity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ageless Entity) was superfluous.  
  
I swung for twenty million, only to have my friend chump-block the Entity and play, of all things, [Marsh Gas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Marsh Gas). I laughed at him, because that only bought him a turn. What could he possibly do to come back from this?   
  
My jaw dropped when he played [Mesmeric Orb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mesmeric Orb). That's the worst I've ever been humiliated in a game of Magic, but I totally deserved it for abusing such a broken card.
posts.html:
I combined this with two Lifegifts and Meloku, the Clouded Mirror to get infinite 1/1 fliers and infinite life. At that point my giant Ageless Entity was superfluous.

I swung for twenty million, only to have my friend chump-block the Entity and play, of all things, Marsh Gas. I laughed at him, because that only bought him a turn. What could he possibly do to come back from this?

My jaw dropped when he played Mesmeric Orb. That's the worst I've ever been humiliated in a game of Magic, but I totally deserved it for abusing such a broken card.

posts.post_content:
This + [Worship](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Worship) + any Ravnica bounce land = indefinite (infinite) landfall providing you control a creature.  
  
Some worthwhile cards for Landfall abuse:  
  
[Admonition Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Admonition Angel) (Exile everything but lands)  
[Adventuring Gear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Adventuring Gear) (Equipped creature buff)  
[Caustic Crawler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Caustic Crawler) (Sweeper - ignores indestructable too)  
[Cosi's Ravager](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cosi's Ravager) (Damage to player/planeswalker)  
[Emeria Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emeria Angel) (Tokens)  
[Grazing Gladehart](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grazing Gladehart) (Life) - Can also use this instead of Worship.  
[Hedron Crab](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hedron Crab) (Mill)  
[Lotus Cobra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Cobra) (Mana of **any** colour)  
[Ob Nixilis, the Fallen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ob Nixilis, the Fallen) (Life loss and +1/+1 counters)  
[Rampaging Baloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rampaging Baloth) (Tokens)  
[Scrib Nibblers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scrib Nibblers) (Library exile + some life gain)  
[Steppe Lynx](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Steppe Lynx) (RAWR kitty!)  
[Turntimber Basilisk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Turntimber Basilisk) (Make everyone block him)  
  
The best part is ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Exclaimer999 (8/6/2012 11:54:17 PM)

posts.post_content:
"This card is a big laugh riot. The only reason this isn't included in the traditional lists of "Power 9" is because it isn't blue." - Justice1337
  
   
Aw, a Blue mage is pouting because Green actually had a powerful card, that didn't involve mindless, stampeding hordes or 1/1 squirrel tokens. I've always loved Fastbond. It's great fun to have in your opening hand and cements Green in its rightful place as the king of fast mana. It's one of the few green mana-related spells that is decisively more powerful than [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual). I guess that irks some people. By the way, I was playing back before Fastbond was restricted to 1 per deck, and it was common to face guys who had 2 or 3 in their deck. Contrary to what "Justice1337" says, this card doesn't automatically make you win the game. Neither does Dark Ritual, and we've faced that one quite a few times, haven't we, boys?
  
   
Fastbond! Enjoy a green powerhouse without fungus, squirrels, or ugly, stinky quadrupeds!
posts.html:

It's one of the few green mana-related spells that is decisively more powerful than Dark Ritual. I guess that irks some people. By the way, I was playing back before Fastbond was restricted to 1 per deck, and it was common to face guys who had 2 or 3 in their deck. Contrary to what "Justice1337" says, this card doesn't automatically make you win the game. Neither does Dark Ritual, and we've faced that one quite a few times, haven't we, boys?

@SlackWareWolf

Advocating for removing the restriction of this card is a joke. You honestly think that the competitive tournament scene would even exist if people were allowed to use these kinds of cards, unrestricted? The price of Moxen, Lotus, Fastbond, Timewalk etc. would precisely quadruple, then the players with the biggest pocketbooks would show up to the PT with a deck that wins on turn 1 90% of its games, then just flip coins for the $30,000 prize. You expect new timmies to show up after the tournies, read play-by-plays of decks that don't interact with each other at all, then say, "Wow, sounds like they had tons of fun. I'm going to drop the cost of a new car for the deck they're running and give it a shot at my local shop."

This card is a big laugh riot. The only reason this isn't included in the traditional lists of "Power 9" is because it isn't blue. You don't even have to think up of fishy combos to exploit it. Just shuffle it in, draw it, and boom, every land... (see all)
